taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

taxonConcepts.scientificName: Ictiobus cyprinellus (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1844)
Ictiobus cyprinellus (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1844)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits main channels, pools and backwaters of small to large rivers.  Also occurs in lakes and impoundments.  Oviparous (Ref. 205).  Feeds on cladocera and cyclopoid copepods supplemented with midge larvae (Ref. 10294).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  Hudson Bay, lower Great Lakes and Mississippi River basins from Ontario to Saskatchewan in Canada and from Montana south to Louisiana in the USA.
dataObjects.references: Page, L.M. and B.M. Burr 1991 A field guide to freshwater fishes of North America north of Mexico. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 432 p. (Ref. 5723)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 123 cm TL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 40637)); max. published weight: 31.9 kg (Ref. 4699); max. reported age: 20 years (Ref. 12193)
references: IGFA 2001 Database of IGFA angling records until 2001. IGFA, Fort Lauderdale, USA. (Ref. 40637)
International Game Fish Association 1991 World record game fishes. International Game Fish Association, Florida, USA. (Ref. 4699)

Hugg, D.O. 1996 MAPFISH georeferenced mapping database. Freshwater and estuarine fishes of North America. Life Science Software. Dennis O. and Steven Hugg, 1278 Turkey Point Road, Edgewater, Maryland, USA. (Ref. 12193)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Oviparous (Ref. 205).  Breed in streams and ponds with rapid flow, on sand and gravel, or in weedy places (Ref. 205). One female may mate with several males (Ref. 205).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: minor commercial; aquaculture: commercial; gamefish: yes

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Taxonomy
dataObjects.description: Comments: Natural hybridization with Ictiobus bubalus was reported by Johnson and Minckley (Copeia 1969:198-200). See Smith (1992) for a study of the phylogeny and biogeography of the Catostomidae.
